alert.note: Alert for Black Hawk; Grundy; Hardin (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 01 at 7:54PM CST until January 02 at 12:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Winter Storm Winding Down This Evening Then Dangerous Cold Overnight... .Snowfall will continue to wind down across the region this evening, primarily from northwest to southeast. Areas of southeast Iowa may continue to see periods of moderate snowfall, but too will wind down over the next few hours. Travel conditions may remain relatively poor even after snowfall ends due to this snowfall easily being blown around and across roadways. Replacing snowfall, and already in place across much of the state, will be bitter to dangerous cold and wind chills lasting into Sunday morning. ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills to around 30 to 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northern and northeast Iowa * WHEN...Until noon CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes or less. Areas that received accumulating snowfall may continue to see hazardous travel at times due to periods of blowing snow.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
